quizzes.question: What is "None" often used to represent?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]None[/h1]

The [b]None[/b] object is used to represent the absence of a value. 
It is similar to [b]null [/b]in other programming languages. 
Like other "empty" values, such as 0, [] and the empty string, it is [b]False[/b] when converted to a Boolean variable. 
When entered at the Python console, it is displayed as the empty string. [code format="py" codeId="357"]>>> None == None
True
>>> None
>>> print(None)
None
>>>[/code]

[h1]None[/h1]

The [b]None [/b]object is returned by any function that doesn't explicitly return anything else. [code format="py" codeId="358"]def some_func():
   print("Hi!")

var = some_func()
print(var)[/code]
[b]Result:[/b] [code format="raw" ]>>>
Hi!
[b]None[/b]
>>>[/code]
